alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 6:31AM PST until January 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in San Francisco CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. For the SALINAS RIVER...including Bradley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...From this morning to this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.0 feet this morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 01/25/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM PST.
